name: James L. KESSLER, individually and Delores M. Kessler, individually, and James L. Kessler, William J. Levine and Maurice E. Rapp, individually and t/a KLR Associates, a Pennsylvania Partnership, Appellees, v. OLD GUARD MUTUAL INSURANCE COMPANY and Harleysville Mutual Insurance Company, Appellants
name_abbreviation: Kessler v. Old Guard Mutual Insurance

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDermott, zappala and papadakos, jj.
parties: James L. KESSLER, individually and Delores M. Kessler, individually, and James L. Kessler, William J. Levine and Maurice E. Rapp, individually and t/a KLR Associates, a Pennsylvania Partnership, Appellees, v. OLD GUARD MUTUAL INSURANCE COMPANY and Harleysville Mutual Insurance Company, Appellants.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Susan M. Danielski, Philadelphia, for appellants.
James C. Hogan, Easton, Thomas J. Maloney, Robert M. Davison, Bethlehem, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
534 A.2d 768
James L. KESSLER, individually and Delores M. Kessler, individually, and James L. Kessler, William J. Levine and Maurice E. Rapp, individually and t/a KLR Associates, a Pennsylvania Partnership, Appellees, v. OLD GUARD MUTUAL INSURANCE COMPANY and Harleysville Mutual Insurance Company, Appellants.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Nov. 9, 1987.
Decided Dec. 24, 1987.
Susan M. Danielski, Philadelphia, for appellants.
James C. Hogan, Easton, Thomas J. Maloney, Robert M. Davison, Bethlehem, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDermott, zappala and papadakos, jj.
